page.title: 11POPULATION
page.content: About 500 people live in the parish of Ashford and Sheldon. The village has changed over the last few years with the building of council houses. The first lot were built in 19 , and the second in 19 . This has allowed a moving population, but movement is fairly slow. There are a lot of well established families but the number of 'newcomers' is growing. It is a fairly close knit community. At Wells Dressing time many women work in groups to do the wells. Most have helped at some time during their lives. The village is tending to become a village of older people, and there are fewer and fewer in school as the years pass. The number dropped from 80 in 1978 to 20 in 1985. The village is very beautiful and has won 'Best Kept Village'award several times.
